summary: testing testing.. is this thing on ?
descriptionHtml:
I only recently discovered ATI/AMD's lovely free tool [url=http://developer.amd.com/tools-and-sdks/archive/legacy-cpu-gpu-tools/cubemapgen/]CubeMapGen[/url], and as a test decided to see what skyrim would look like if all the environment / reflection maps were nice and fuzzy :). This is by no means near what I would think on as a polished mod, more something I found interesting and felt like sharing.

Please let me know if I have done anything silly, or if you have any suggestions[color=#00ff00].[/color][color=#6aa84f].[/color][color=#38761D].[/color]

I'm using a slightly edited (can't help it !) but at least relatively new RealVision ENB 279b now, alongside enhanced lights and FX and a lot of other mods[color=#00ff00].[/color][color=#6aa84f].[/color][color=#38761D]. [/color]I just noticed I am using the dwarven armor textures from [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24909/?]aMidianBorn Book of Silence[/url] in this playthrough[color=#00ff00].[/color][color=#6aa84f].[/color][color=#38761D].[/color] "vanilla" in the screenshots applies only to the reflection maps ;).

[color=#a2c4c9]Tutorial / DIY image update [color=#3c78d8]:[/color][/color] I'm not sure why but using 16bit float output from CubeMapGen resulted in half of the nice clean seamed vanilla versions I'm working on for 0.2 becoming corrupted :/, updated the image to show the 8-bit RGB I actually used for version 0.1
author: SpookyMunky
